name: Artemis I
description: Uncrewed test flight of the Orion spacecraft and Space Launch System rocket, paving the way for crewed lunar missions.

timeline.event: Entered distant retrograde orbit around Moon

impact: Artemis I successfully tested all systems needed to send astronauts to the Moon in future missions. This mission verified that the spacecraft can safely carry humans through deep space and return home.

name: Mars 2020 (Perseverance)
description: Rover mission to search for signs of ancient microbial life and collect rock samples for future return to Earth.

timeline.event: Ingenuity first flight (first powered flight on another planet)

impact: Perseverance is searching for signs of ancient life on Mars and collecting samples that will be returned to Earth. The mission also includes Ingenuity, which proved that powered flight is possible on Mars, opening new possibilities for future exploration.

name: James Webb Space Telescope
description: The most powerful space telescope ever built, designed to see the first galaxies formed after the Big Bang and study exoplanet atmospheres.
impact: JWST is revolutionizing our understanding of the universe by capturing infrared light from the earliest galaxies, studying star and planet formation, and analyzing the atmospheres of exoplanets to search for signs of habitability.

name: ISS Expedition 70
description: Current expedition aboard the International Space Station conducting scientific research in microgravity.
impact: ISS expeditions conduct hundreds of experiments that benefit life on Earth, including developing new medicines, improving crop yields, creating advanced materials, and testing technologies for long-duration spaceflight.

name: Psyche
description: Mission to explore a unique metal-rich asteroid that may be the exposed core of an early planet.
impact: The Psyche asteroid is thought to be the exposed metallic core of a protoplanet. Studying it helps us understand how Earth and other rocky planets formed and differentiated into layers.

name: Europa Clipper
description: Mission to Jupiter's moon Europa to investigate its potential habitability and subsurface ocean.
impact: Europa has a global ocean beneath its icy crust that may contain twice as much water as all of Earth's oceans combined. This mission will determine if Europa has conditions suitable for life.

name: Lucy
description: First mission to explore the Trojan asteroids that share Jupiter's orbit around the Sun.
impact: Trojan asteroids are fossils from the early solar system. Lucy will help us understand how the giant planets formed and the solar system evolved to its current state.

name: Chandrayaan-3
description: India's successful lunar landing mission, making ISRO the fourth space agency to achieve a soft landing on the Moon.

timeline.event: Successful landing near lunar south pole

impact: Chandrayaan-3 demonstrated precision landing technology and explored the Moon's south pole region, which may contain water ice. It showcased India's growing capabilities in space exploration.

name: Dragonfly
description: Rotorcraft lander mission to explore Saturn's moon Titan, the only moon with a dense atmosphere.
impact: Titan has organic-rich chemistry similar to early Earth. Dragonfly will fly to different locations to study the moon's habitability and chemistry, searching for signs of past or present life.

name: Lunar Gateway
description: Small space station in lunar orbit that will serve as a staging point for Artemis lunar missions and future Mars expeditions.
impact: Gateway will enable sustainable lunar exploration and serve as a testbed for technologies needed for Mars missions. It will also allow longer lunar surface stays and access to more locations on the Moon.

name: Tianzhou Cargo Missions
description: Cargo spacecraft delivering supplies to China's Tiangong space station.
impact: Tianzhou missions support China's permanent space station operations, delivering experiments, food, water, and equipment. This demonstrates China's growing capabilities in human spaceflight.

name: OSIRIS-REx
description: Successfully collected samples from asteroid Bennu and returned them to Earth.
impact: OSIRIS-REx returned the largest asteroid sample ever collected. Studying these pristine materials helps us understand the early solar system and the origins of life on Earth.

name: Hubble Space Telescope
description: Iconic space telescope that has transformed our understanding of the universe for over 30 years.
impact: Hubble has made over 1.5 million observations, helping determine the age of the universe, discovering dark energy, finding exoplanets, and capturing stunning images that inspire people worldwide.

name: DART (Double Asteroid Redirection Test)
description: First mission to test planetary defense by deliberately crashing into an asteroid to change its orbit.
impact: DART proved that kinetic impact can successfully deflect an asteroid. This technology could one day protect Earth from a hazardous asteroid on a collision course with our planet.

name: Starlink
description: Satellite internet constellation providing global broadband coverage, especially to underserved areas.
impact: Starlink brings high-speed internet to remote and rural areas without traditional internet infrastructure. It has also provided communications during natural disasters and conflicts.
